item.title: Damage Absoption
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:27, topic:371516”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=467602.msg3423189#msg3423189 date=1291682471]

[quote author=abatssk8ter link=topic=467602.msg3422338#msg3422338 date=1291602751]

Why does jagex keep fucking with PvP!@ LEAVE IT THE FUCK ALONE.

they already ruined enough since 2007
[/quote]I think it’s a good way to make pures more balanced. You need to admit that they are pretty unfair.

They sacrifice their defence potential while non-pures sacrifice their strength potential. Seems balanced to me.
[/quote]at 99range, you can have 80str without leveling…

What in the world are you talking about? At 99 range, you can get 99 strength and 50 attack without leveling… Not 80 str…

50 99 1 with 94 hp, 99 range and magic, 44 prayer works out to be 77 combat. If those accounts are happy to use magic and melee/range against people in armour then there’s no reason that they can’t kill tonnes of armoured players.

By comparison, a standard level 77 would have roughly flat 62s (including hp) and 43 prayer. 99 range hits far more consistently on rune armour than a scimitar and 50 attack does, so the armour doesn’t mean as much as you’d think.[/quote]
I know that; I wasn’t asking a question.

Read full topic

Why does jagex keep fucking with PvP!@ LEAVE IT THE FUCK ALONE.

they already ruined enough since 2007
[/quote]I think it’s a good way to make pures more balanced. You need to admit that they are pretty unfair.

They sacrifice their defence potential while non-pures sacrifice their strength potential. Seems balanced to me.
[/quote]at 99range, you can have 80str without leveling…

What in the world are you talking about? At 99 range, you can get 99 strength and 50 attack without leveling… Not 80 str…[/quote]
50 99 1 with 94 hp, 99 range and magic, 44 prayer works out to be 77 combat. If those accounts are happy to use magic and melee/range against people in armour then there’s no reason that they can’t kill tonnes of armoured players.

By comparison, a standard level 77 would have roughly flat 62s (including hp) and 43 prayer. 99 range hits far more consistently on rune armour than a scimitar and 50 attack does, so the armour doesn’t mean as much as you’d think.

item.title: Damage Absoption
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=467602.msg3422058#msg3422058 date=1291590254]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=467602.msg3420752#msg3420752 date=1291495432]

Ehh, this update surprised me a lot. They are revamping their entire combat system to incorporate this damage soaking. This is a pretty massive update, so it’s going to be interesting to see the reactions and successes/failures of it. I think it’s going to make battles last a lot longer now, making special items and such a lot harder to get. We’ll see, I guess.
[/quote]Yea, I agree that high level battles (with both people having a high defense) might last a lot longer.

Which is fucking horrible in F2P, since high level fights with armor on take forever anyways.
[/quote]True, and this will probably increase the chances of people fleeing/safing, as some people may hit a lot higher than others.[/quote]
That probably means my corrupt weps will be of no use.

Read full topic

item.title: Damage Absoption
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:371516”]I’d just like to mention that I have a tank ranger, which means maximum DPS through maxed range skill and ice barrage as a secondary means of attack, near maximum damage soaking (90+ defence), and high health capacity – all at 101 combat. XD

The only way the account could improve would be the addition of 92 prayer, which I can’t afford. Unfortunate.

The only problem that remains is the vast price gap between mid range armour (ie, rune armour) and high end armour. Unfortunately they can’t solve this with the current armour sets, which are ‘special’ in that they can’t be created by players.
If they re-evaluate the smithing skill, and rebalance it in such a way that a smithing level equivalent to an attack or defence level allows the creation of weapons/armour appropriate for that level, then they partially alleviate this problem.

The remaining problem is simple: Do we want to add more value to the player-created items by making their stats slightly higher, or do we want to encourage boss hunting by making monster-dropped armour/weapons better?
The problem is that if they’re identical then their demand, and therefore price, is coupled together – the arguably easier to acquire player-created weapons/armour will drop in price, and no reason will exist to pay for the exotic monster-dropped gear in the eyes of your functional player, thus inducing a drop in value that reflects the drop in value of the player-created gear.

tl;dr: Big step has been taken towards fixing a very old problem, but there are still some deeply seated flaws.[/quote]
I don’t think that they will allow to create ‘special’ items such as Bandos, Dragon, etc.
But I’m sure if they did, they wouldn’t make it with a mine an ore and smith it, if that is the case; they would probably create a certain percentage to get it.
Some small percentage such as 12%.

Read full topic

item.title: Damage Absoption
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’d just like to mention that I have a tank ranger, which means maximum DPS through maxed range skill and ice barrage as a secondary means of attack, near maximum damage soaking (90+ defence), and high health capacity – all at 101 combat. XD

The only way the account could improve would be the addition of 92 prayer, which I can’t afford. Unfortunate.

The only problem that remains is the vast price gap between mid range armour (ie, rune armour) and high end armour. Unfortunately they can’t solve this with the current armour sets, which are ‘special’ in that they can’t be created by players.
If they re-evaluate the smithing skill, and rebalance it in such a way that a smithing level equivalent to an attack or defence level allows the creation of weapons/armour appropriate for that level, then they partially alleviate this problem.

The remaining problem is simple: Do we want to add more value to the player-created items by making their stats slightly higher, or do we want to encourage boss hunting by making monster-dropped armour/weapons better?
The problem is that if they’re identical then their demand, and therefore price, is coupled together – the arguably easier to acquire player-created weapons/armour will drop in price, and no reason will exist to pay for the exotic monster-dropped gear in the eyes of your functional player, thus inducing a drop in value that reflects the drop in value of the player-created gear.

tl;dr: Big step has been taken towards fixing a very old problem, but there are still some deeply seated flaws.

Read full topic
